venue.name: Fearing Pond, Myles Standish State Forest

item.description:
Want to go fishing during April Vacation? Come to Myles Standish State Forest’s Fearing Pond Day Use Area and try your hand at it. Fearing Pond is stocked with trout and has lots of hungry bluegills just waiting for your worm! MA fishing license is not required. Bring your fishing pole or borrow one of ours (limited supply). We’ll provide the worms!

Meet at Fearing Pond day use area parking lot (about 10 minutes from Headquarters). This program is for ages 6+ and open to the public.

 

Parents must accompany children. Rain will cancel. Call Amy at (508) 272-9376 for more information. For park information, a park map, and directions visit http://www.mass.gov/dcr/parks/southeast/mssf.htm. This free program is sponsored by the Massachusetts Department of Conservation & Recreation.
item.how_to_find_us: Look for Amy Wilmot, DCR Regional Interpretive Coordinator
item.why: Fearing Pond is stocked with trout and has lots of hungry bluegills just waiting for your worm!

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Take the kids fishing, ages 6+
